properties.name: Achievement System Example
properties.description: A simple achievement system for players while playing the game.
properties.author: ISS PRODUCTIONS

objects.name: FooterText
objects.string: Made for the GDevelop Examples Jam #1 by ISS PRODUCTIONS

events.comment:
Welcome to my example for Achievements System in GDevelop!
This is the enhanced version of my example game which includes a simple indicator when a player earned a specific achievement.
When the cursor touches either the StartGameButton or AchievementsMenuButton text object, set the text style of each text object to italic and bold to show interactivity.
When the player clicks on either StartGameButton or AchievementsMenuButton text object, the game will proceed to go to the respective scenes.

objects.name: ExitText
objects.string:
Press Escape to return to main menu.
Hint: Red - Player | Yellow - Coin | Purple - Enemy

events.comment:
This is the Game Screen where I made a simple mini game to demonstrate how players can unlock achievements during game play.
When the scene starts, save the position of the player.
Updates to the player's gameplay statistics (scores) to track the player's progress for all achievements.
When the player dies (fall outside of screen), add 1 to the number of times the player died global variable.
When the player completed an achievement, a simple indicator telling the player that they have earned it will be shown.
When the player collects a coin, the coin will be removed and a value of 50 will be added to the number of coins collected global variable.
When the player completed an achievement, a simple indicator telling the player that they have earned it will be shown.
When the player hits an enemy, the enemy will be removed and a value of 1 will be added to the number of enemies killed global variable.
When the player completed an achievement, a simple indicator telling the player that they have earned it will be shown.
When the player presses the Escape key, the game will stop and return to the main screen.

objects.name: SceneTitleDescription
objects.string: Your earned achievements will be displayed here.

objects.name: Achievement2Description
objects.string: Kill a minimum of 10 enemies in multiple playthroughs.

objects.name: Achievement3Description
objects.string: Die at least 10 times in multiple playthroughs.

objects.name: Achievement1Description
objects.string: Collect a minimum of 500 coins in multiple playthroughs.

events.comment:
This is the Achievements Screen where the player's achievements earned from the game screen can be seen here.
Check the global variables for all achievements every time the player accesses this screen.
If the collected player stats equal of more than the achievement's requirement, change the text object to 'Complete!' to show the player that the achievement has been achieved.
When the cursor touches the BackButton text object, set the text style to italic and bold to show interactivity.
When the cursor is not touching the BackButton text object, set the style of the text back to normal.
When the player clicks the BackButton text object, go back to the main screen.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Elairyx, @Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allows to set up checkpoints for each instance.
Checkpoint coordinates are dynamic values so can be object positions absolute/relative values and more.
Checkpoints can then be used to move the same or even other instances to them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkpoints

eventsFunctions.description: Update a checkpoint of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: SaveCheckpoint

eventsFunctions.description: Change the position of the object to the saved checkpoint.
eventsFunctions.name: LoadCheckpoint

parameters.longDescription: Loading not yet saved checkpoints will (by default) set the position to the coordinate 0;0. Select "yes" to completely ignore non-existant checkpoints. To define an alternative checkpoint for it, create a new event and use the "Checkpoint exists" condition, save the wanted checkpoint as the action.
parameters.name: SetIgnoreUndefined

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a checkpoint has a position saved / does exist.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckpointExist
